name: Jouni Helske
body:
I am an almost PhD in Statistics (estimated dissertation in October 2015) from University of Jyväskylä, Finland. My main interests are state space models, forecasting and R in all of its forms.

# Publications

* Jouni Helske. KFAS: Exponential family state space models in R. Submitted to Journal of Statistical Software, 2015.
* Perttu J.J. Luukko, Jouni Helske, and Esa Räsänen. Introducing libeemd: A program package for performing the ensemble empirical mode decomposition. Accepted byComputational Statistics, 2015.
* Jouni Helske and Jukka Nyblom. Improved frequentist prediction intervals for autoregressive models by simulation. In Siem Jan Koopman and Neil Shephard, editors, Unobserved Components and Time Series Econometrics. Oxford University Press, 2015. In press.
* Jouni Helske and Jukka Nyblom. Improved frequentist prediction intervals for arma models by simulation. In Johan Knif and Bernd Pape, editors, Contributions to Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, and Finance: essays in honour of professor Seppo Pynnönen, number 296 in Acta Wasaensia, pages 71–86. University of Vaasa, 2014.
* Jouni Helske, Jukka Nyblom, Petri Ekholm, and Kristian Meissner. Estimating aggregated nutrient fluxes in four finnish rivers via gaussian state space models. Environmetrics, 24(4):237–247, 2013.
* Jouni Helske, Mervi Eerola, and Ioan Tabus. Minimum description length based hidden markov model clustering for life sequence analysis. In Workshop on Information Theoretic Methods in Science and Engineering, 2010.

# Posters
* [KFAS: Exponential family state space models in R](http://users.jyu.fi/~jovetale/posters/KFASposter.pdf). UseR!2015 conference, Aalborg, Denmark. Won the best poster award.
* [Estimating yearly nutrient fluxes via Gaussian state space models](http://users.jyu.fi/~jovetale/posters/limnological2013.pdf). Limnological Days 2013, Helsinki, Finland.
